definitions.definition: the flat part of a knife, tool or machine, which has a sharp edge or edges for cutting

examples.text: The machine comes with a plastic guard over the blade to protect the operator.
Knife blades are generally made of stainless steel.
The prisoner used a hacksaw blade to cut through the bars.
He swung the blade with all his strength.
The swordsmen weaved and dodged as their blades clashed over and over again.

definitions.definition: one of the flat parts that turn around in an engine or on a helicopter
the flat wide part of an oar (= one of the long straight pieces of wood that are used to row a boat) that goes in the water
a single flat leaf of grass

examples.text: Not a blade of grass stirred.

definitions.definition: the flat metal part on the bottom of an ice skate

wordOrigin: Old English blæd ‘leaf of a plant’ (also in sense (2)), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch blad and German Blatt.
